GeneralNotes: canons repeat and supplement those of legatine council of London 1237; acc. Cheney (p739), "these became the most important single collection of local law for the English Church. They were much copied and some parts were constantly cited by bishops in the course of their administration. Their enforcement was required by a papal mandate obtained by the bishop of Norwich in 1272..."
Scottish bishops refused to accept the canons (see Watts, Church Councils, 93-95)
